revised_title: On the Properties of Matter in Gaseous and Liquid States under Various Conditions of Temperature and Pressure
tldr: The author investigates the properties of matter in gaseous and liquid states under various conditions of temperature and pressure, confirming Dalton's law for most cases of gas and vapor mixtures. However, an exception is found in mixtures of liquids capable of dissolving each other, where chemical affinities come into play, affecting the results.
